cyclone.name: MARIA
cyclone.current_location: about 545 miles ESE of the Lesser Antilles
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest toward the Leeward Islands, then forecast to pass near or over Puerto Rico by mid-week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Antigua, Barbuda, St. Kitts, Nevis, Montserrat, Guadeloupe, Saba, St. Eustatius, St. Maarten and Anguilla; Tropical Storm Watch for St. Lucia, Martinique, Dominica, Barbados, St. Vincent and the Grenadines
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico and eastern Hispaniola within the 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) becoming likely at San Juan by late Tuesday night or Wednesday, with a chance of hurricane-force gusts if María intensifies sooner.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Coastal inundation of 3–5 ft is possible along north and east-facing shores of Puerto Rico if the center passes close to the island.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 6 inches or more of rainfall producing flash flooding and mudslides.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning Tuesday; possible port-side debris and power disruptions.
